intro: Cyrtandra greenwoodiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically orange or red in color. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
